page.title: 03History Shenley & Whaddon
page.content: Shenley Toot is a field of sheep and hummocky unexcavated earthworks. There is a moated site which may have been a Roman camp & later a homestead. Westbury farm is a moated homestead with a large wooden door reputed to have been made from a Portuguese ship. Nothing is left of Snellshall Priory except earthworks.It fell into ruin & was dissolved in 1535.The remains were used to build St Giles' church, Tattenhoe.Whaddon or Wheathill/Whaddon though the huntsmen & hounds now gather in Winslow & there are no kennel kennels in Kennel Lane. Queen Elizabeth honoured the country house of Whaddon Hall with a visit. Spenser composed'The Faery Queen' under an oak in its grounds. Cuttings from the Glastonbury thorn are said to grow in the churchyard at Whaddon & in a field near St Mary's church Shenley.
